parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the Direct Ignition Cassette can cause the engine to stall or lose power, leading to a loss of control, accidents, or stranding the driver on the highway.
symptoms: the engine stalls or loses power
the vehicle is unable to restart
burning electrical smell and smoke come from the engine
and the vehicle experiences sudden loss of power while driving at high speeds.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Fuel Line Failure and Gasoline Leak
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the fuel line and subsequent gasoline leak can cause a fire hazard, potentially leading to accidents, injuries, or fatalities.
symptoms: especially when stopped for a period of time
gasoline leaking onto the engine or ground
and blown hose at the fuel pump.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Oil Pump Intake Screen Plugging due to Oil Degradation
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The plugging of the oil pump intake screen can cause a lack of oil circulation, leading to complete engine failure, which can result in accidents, strand the driver, and lead to costly repairs.
The failure of the crank sensor can cause the vehicle to stall intermittently, leading to inconvenience, accidents, and strand the driver.

The design of the Saab 9-3's oil system, which allows oil to degrade due to heat from the turbocharger and catalytic converter, can lead to complete engine failure, resulting in accidents, strand the driver, and lead to costly repairs.
The recommended oil change interval of 10,000 miles may be insufficient, leading to oil degradation and engine failure, which can result in accidents, strand the driver, and lead to costly repairs.
